content.description: Concerned about the length of high school basketball games, the governing body for high school sports in a certain state is investigating the possibility of shortening game length if the mean game length is greater than <math alttext="90" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes. A random sample of <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> games from the current season was selected, and the sample mean game length was <math alttext="95" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes with a sample standard deviation of <math alttext="10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes.
content.question: Assuming that the distribution of game length is approximately normal, which of the following is the appropriate probability statement for determining the <math alttext="p" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value of the hypothesis test to investigate whether the mean game length is greater than <math alttext="90" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>90</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> minutes?

choices.label: <math alttext="the probability of, open parenthesis, t is greater than the complex fraction with numerator 95 minus 90, and denominator the fraction 10 over the square root of 25, end root, end fraction, end complex fraction, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>></mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>95</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>90</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, where <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> follows a <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution with <math alttext="24" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> degrees of freedom.

<math alttext="the probability of, open parenthesis, t is greater than the complex fraction with numerator 90 minus 95, and denominator the fraction 10 over the square root of 25, end root, end fraction, end complex fraction, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>></mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>90</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>95</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, where <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> follows a <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution with <math alttext="24" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> degrees of freedom.

<math alttext="the probability of, open parenthesis, t is greater than the complex fraction with numerator 90 minus 95, and denominator the fraction 10 over the square root of 25, end root, end fraction, end complex fraction, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>></mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>90</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>95</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, where <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> follows a <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution with <math alttext="25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> degrees of freedom.

<math alttext="the probability of, open parenthesis, t is greater than the complex fraction with numerator 90 minus 95, and denominator the fraction 10 over the square root of 25, end root, end fraction, end complex fraction, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>z</mi> <mo>></mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>90</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>95</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, where <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> follows a standard normal distribution.

<math alttext="the probability of, open parenthesis, t is greater than the complex fraction with numerator 90 minus 95, and denominator the fraction 10 over the square root of 25, end root, end fraction, end complex fraction, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>z</mi> <mo>></mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>95</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>90</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, where <math alttext="z" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> follows a standard normal distribution.

content.answer: <math alttext="the probability of, open parenthesis, t is greater than the complex fraction with numerator 95 minus 90, and denominator the fraction 10 over the square root of 25, end root, end fraction, end complex fraction, close parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>P</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>></mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>95</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mn>90</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> <mrow> <msqrt> <mrow> <mn>25</mn> </mrow> </msqrt> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, where <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> follows a <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-distribution with <math alttext="24" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> degrees of freedom.

topic.text: 7.5: Carrying Out a Test for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Calculate a test statistic and find a p-value, provided conditions for inference are met.
